Debrief form


Title of Study: Investigating stigma, autistic traits, environmental behaviour, anxiety, depression and mental health response to the COVID pandemic

Supervisors: Email: Phone:
Dr Anthony Haffey a.haffey@reading.ac.uk 0118 378 8850
Keren MacLennan k.r.maclennan@pgr.reading.ac.uk
Dr Nick Thompson n.thompson@reading.ac.uk
Tim Rossow t.w.l.rossow@pgr.reading.ac.uk

Thank you for participating in the study. The aim of this study was to explore the relationships between social communication, mood, worry, resilience during lockdown and pleasant image preferences. Further, we were interested in investigating differences in way people view different concepts, including environmentally friendly beliefs and whether they predicted environmentally friendly behaviour.

We hope that you have found the study interesting and have not been upset by any of the topics discussed. However, if you have found any part of this experience to be distressing and you wish to speak to one of the research supervisors, please contact: Dr Anthony Haffey (a.haffey@reading.ac.uk), Dr Nick Thompson (n.thompson@reading.ac.uk), Keren MacLennan (k.r.maclennan@pgr.reading.ac.uk) or Tim Rossow (t.w.l.rossow@pgr.reading.ac.uk).

There are also a number of organisations listed below that you can contact.

Organisation What they offer Contact Details
Mind Promotes the views and needs of people with mental health difficulties. Ph: 0300 123 3393
(Monday-Friday, 9am to 6pm)
Web: www.mind.org.uk
SANE Emotional support, information and guidance for people affected by mental illness, their families and carers. Ph: 0300 304 7000
(Daily, 4.30pm to 10.30pm)
Webs: www.sane.org.uk/support
National Autistic Society Provides advice, guidance, help and support on the challenges autistic people and their families face. Web: www.autism.org.uk
NHS One You Tips, tools and support to help you get healthier and feel better. Includes COVID tips and support Web: www.nhs.uk/oneyou
Friends of the Earth Part of an international community dedicated to protecting the natural world and the wellbeing of everyone in it. Web: friendsoftheearth.uk

Your GP can also help you find specific support services in your local area. If you are in immediate risk, or you feel like you cannot keep yourself safe, please phone 999.

Thank you again for taking part in our research, and please feel free to contact Dr Anthony Haffey (a.haffey@reading.ac.uk) should you have any questions, concerns or feedback.
